KWB FIRING SYSTEM:

The firing system is designed as a stoker-fed firing system with rotary ring grate. The fuel is pushed sideways onto the rotary grate consisting of numerous rings. The fuel is transported by the rotary movement of the grate thus providing for a completely smooth fuel bed and optimum low dust emissions.

The stoker worm is fitted with a spiral progressively increasing in size to prevent congestion. Primary combustion air is supplied by means of speed-regulated ventilators beneath the rotary ring grate and enabled by a special air-distribution system
column2: which allows for a progressive
column3: staged air supply despite the rotary movement of the grate. The staged air supply enables the amount of air added to be optimally adjusted to the gasification speed of the fuel on the grate.

column1: The fuel system is suitable for the burning of wood chips B1 and B2 according to CEN TC 335 and wood pellets according to Austrian standard EN 14961-2 as well as industrial wood pellets.
Ignition of the fuel is carried out fully automatically using preheated air (power rating: 1
column2: 400 Watt). After complete burnout
column3: the ash is discharged from the firebox by means of a specially developed cleaning system and onto the ash-extractor worm beneath the firing system
column4: which transports the ash to the integrated ash container.

column1: A gas-tight and self-closing fire shutter serves as a backfire protection device (BPD) and thermal acting backfire safeguard. Tight fit of the fire shutter is tested and approved by the Institute of Fire and Security Technology and the shutter also closes automatically in case of power failure by means of the spring return motor (1.5 Nm). The thermal backfire safeguard is designed as an emergency fire extinguisher for putting out fires and works without electricity.
The wood gases are completely burnt in the downstream secondary burning zone
column2: which is designed as an upright rotational combustion chamber. The rotational combustion chamber provides a vortex flow of the flue-gas-air-mixture in combination with a specially developed secondary air jet and thus guarantees optimum combustion conditions and lowest emissions. Drawn-in dust particles are additionally intercepted onto the wall of the rotational combustion chamber by means of the vortex flow and thus lowest dust emissions are achieved.

Un particolare sistema di distribuzione dell’aria assicura un apporto progressivo ed omogeneo in tutte le zone nonostante il movimento di rotazione. L’apporto progressivo fa sì che il sistema adegui perfettamente la quantità di aria immessa alla velocità di gasificazione del combustibile presente sulla griglia.

KWB FIRING SYSTEM:

The firing system is designed as a stoker-fed firing system with rotary ring grate. The fuel is pushed sideways onto the rotary grate consisting of numerous rings. The fuel is transported by the rotary movement of the grate thus providing for a completely smooth fuel bed and optimum low dust emissions.

The stoker worm is fitted with a spiral progressively increasing in size to prevent congestion. Primary combustion air is supplied by means of speed-regulated ventilators beneath the rotary ring grate and enabled by a special air-distribution system
column2: which allows for a progressive
column3: staged air supply despite the rotary movement of the grate. The staged air supply enables the amount of air added to be optimally adjusted to the gasification speed of the fuel on the grate.

column1: The fuel system is suitable for the burning of wood chips B1 and B2 according to CEN TC 335 and wood pellets according to Austrian standard EN 14961-2 as well as industrial wood pellets.

column3: the ash is discharged from the firebox by means of a specially developed cleaning system and onto the ash-extractor worm beneath the firing system

column1: A gas-tight and self-closing fire shutter serves as a backfire protection device (BPD) and thermal acting backfire safeguard. Tight fit of the fire shutter is tested and approved by the Institute of Fire and Security Technology and the shutter also closes automatically in case of power failure by means of the spring return motor (1.5 Nm). The thermal backfire safeguard is designed as an emergency fire extinguisher for putting out fires and works without electricity.
The wood gases are completely burnt in the downstream secondary burning zone
column2: which is designed as an upright rotational combustion chamber. Drawn-in dust particles are additionally intercepted onto the wall of the rotational combustion chamber by means of the vortex flow and thus lowest dust emissions are achieved.

SYSTÈME DE COMBUSTION KWB :

Système de combustion à alimentation automatique avec grille tournante. Le combustible est poussé latéralement sur une grille tournante composée de plusieurs anneaux. Le combustible est acheminé grâce au mouvement de rotation de la grille. Cette technique permet d’obtenir un lit de combustible particulièrement stable et régulier
column2: d’où des conditions optimales pour le processus de gazéification.

column1: La vis d’alimentation est une vis à pas progressif conçue pour empêcher tout bourrage. L’alimentation en air primaire s’effectue au moyen de ventilateurs à vitesse variable. Cet air est amené sous la grille tournante par un système spécial de répartition de l’air qui
column2: malgré le mouvement de rotation de la grille
column3: permet d’assurer une alimentation en air à la fois graduelle et échelonnée par zone. Le contrôle du débit de l’air permet d’adapter parfaitement les quantités d’air envoyées dans la chambre de combustion à la vitesse de la gazéification du combustible sur la grille tournante.

La cendre tombe sur une vis de décendrage située sous le système de combustion. Celle-ci transfère ensuite la cendre vers le cendrier placé contre la chaudière.

Le dispositif de sécurité contre les retours de flammes est composé d’un clapet coupe-feu entièrement étanche aux gaz et fumées ainsi que d’un dispositif de sécurité à effet thermique. Le clapet coupe-feu a été contrôlé et homologué par l’Institut des techniques de protection anti-incendie de Linz. Sa fermeture est automatique (même en cas de coupure de courant) et s’effectue au moyen d’un servomoteur à ressort de rappel (1
column2: 5 Nm). Le dispositif de sécurité à effet thermique est un dispositif d’extinction de secours qui fonctionne sans alimentation électrique.
